sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not distributive over complement.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3, 4} and B = {2, 3, 4, 5}. Take the complement of set A and set B. Calculate the symmetric difference of (A ∪ B) and the complement of set B, then calculate the symmetric difference of (A Δ B) and the complement of set B. Show that the symmetric difference of (A ∪ B) and the complement of set B is not equal to the symmetric difference of (A Δ B) and the complement of set B, proving that the symmetric difference of two sets is not distributive over complement.
